meanings.definition: To set or place in a chase or secure mounting.
meanings.sent1: She enchases the precious gem in the necklace.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler enchases the diamond in the ring carefully.
meanings.sent3: The artist enchases the colorful stones in the bracelet with precision.
meanings.sent4: Her smile enchases the beauty of the room like a radiant light.
meanings.sent5: The way he enchases the artwork in the gallery makes it truly stand out.

meanings.definition: To ornament by embossing or engraving.
meanings.sent1: He enchases the silver locket with intricate patterns.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman enchases the metal plate with elegant designs.
meanings.sent3: The baker enchases the cake with delicate icing flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter enchases the moment with joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The way the sun enchases the clouds with golden hues is breathtaking.
